title: Cannot store matplotlib.pyplot figure objects with dependence_plot instead of plotting them
body:
When using `shap.dependence_plot`, how do I store the figure objects in a variable (to use later) instead of directly plotting them?

I got it to work when using `shap_values`, but can't get it to work with `shap_interaction_values`. This is what I've done: in the `shap.dependence plot` function definition, I replaced `pl.show()` with `fig = pl.figure()` in the beginning and `return fig` in the end. So, there are 2 places where `return fig` appears - one when using `shap_interaction_values`, where its a recursive function call, where I replaced 
```
if show:
     pl.show()
     return
```
with `return fig`, and one at the end of the function where I replaced
```
if show:
     pl.show()
```
with `return fig`.

This works with `shap_values` like so, where it doesn't plot anything and stores the figure object in the variable:

```
lis = []
for i in features:
    mpl_fig = shap_dependence_plot ( i, shap_values, X )
    plotly_fig = mpl_to_plotly(mpl_fig)
    lis.append(plotly_fig)
lis
```

But it doesn't work when using `shap_interaction_values`, because it tries to plot the figure:

```
lis = []
for i in features:
    for j in features:
        mpl_fig = shap_dependence_plot ( (i, j), shap_interaction_values, X )
        plotly_fig = mpl_to_plotly(mpl_fig)
        lis.append(plotly_fig)
lis
```
Because it tries to plot the figure, I get an error saying that it can't get the figure bounds (which is required when converting it to a plotly figure object). This is demonstrated by the following code trying to get the axis bounds, which works when using `shap_values` and gives error when using `shap_interaction_values`:

```
x_min, x_max, y_min, y_max = [], [], [], []
for axes_obj in mpl_fig.get_axes():
    bounds = axes_obj.get_position().bounds
    x_min.append(bounds[0])
    x_max.append(bounds[0]+bounds[2])
    y_min.append(bounds[1])
    y_max.append(bounds[1]+bounds[3])
x_min, y_min, x_max, y_max = min(x_min), min(y_min), max(x_max), max(y_max)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-82-03390f6b487d> in <module>()
     13     y_min.append(bounds[1])
     14     y_max.append(bounds[1]+bounds[3])
---> 15 x_min, y_min, x_max, y_max = min(x_min), min(y_min), max(x_max), max(y_max)

ValueError: min() arg is an empty sequence
```
Further drilling down,

```
mpl_fig = shap_dependence_plot(i, shap_values, X)
len(mpl_fig.get_axes())
>>> 2
```

But:

```
mpl_fig = shap_dependence_plot((i, j), shap_interaction_values, X)
len(mpl_fig.get_axes())
>>> 0
```

So, it would be a great help if you could kindly point to how I could get it to not plot and just store the figure object.
